column4: /bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off - I'm dual boot dapper and winxp, everything was working fine, until I wend into windows downloaded acrobat reader, and then tried to boot back to ubuntu. What do I do?
before you booted windows you did something ubuntu which caused this. not downloading acrobat
I loaded a .pdf to a thumbdrive using ubuntu - so I could load it to windows when I booted it. - Could that be it?
please do. better for the planet and the gators need food
lol
/me text
If you tell me to beat my PC...I'll do it.
what has that poor PC done to you. beat thyself
doing what?
http://blog.shevin.info/2007/04/how-did-i-fix-cant-acess-tty-in-feisty.html
try a different kernel
Didn't work - I could boot and mount on Live CD though - but if I can't get it all fixed that is somewhat pointless too.
Also it's not the kernel - because it worked before with the same exact kernel.
does grep work? is any partition mounted?
Nothing gets mounted
how did you check?
That nothing was mounted? Because the error poped up before anything could mount
that is not true
if nothing was mounted how did ash run?
I don't know, but ask gives only a few commands- none of which can help me from what I can tell.
does udev load?
Not that I saw.
